name: Fractured Best Actors Multiple Choice Quiz | Fractured Celebrities | 20 Questions

questions.explanation:
Jack Lemmon.

	"Save the Tiger," 1973

Richard Dreyfuss.

	"The Goodbye Girl," 1977

Dustin Hoffman.

	"Kramer vs. Kramer," 1979 and "Rain Man," 1988

Marlon Brando.

	"The Godfather," 1972. He refused to accept the award. His reason was that Native Americans are not treated fairly in the United States. Sadly, he passed away in 2004.

William Hurt.

	"Kiss of the Spider Woman," 1985

Michael Douglas.

	"Wall Street," 1987. ('Muggle' means 'non-magical' in the Harry Potter books.)

questions.correct: George C. Scott & George C Scott
questions.explanation:
George C. Scott & George C Scott

	"Patton," 1970. He refused to accept the award, saying he didn't act in order to compete with other actors.

Jeremy Irons.

	"Reversal of Fortune," 1990

Al Pacino.

	"Scent of a Woman," 1992

Cliff Robertson.

	"Charly," 1968

questions.correct: F. Murray Abraham & F Murray Abraham
questions.explanation:
F. Murray Abraham & F Murray Abraham

	"Amadeus," 1984

Robert Duvall.

	"Tender Mercies," 1983. I loved that movie! He was also terrific in "The Great Santini."

Anthony Hopkins.

	"Silence of the Lambs," 1991. I adore A.H. He was terrific in "The Bounty," too.

Rod Steiger.

	"In the Heat of the Night," 1967

Kevin Spacey.

	"American Beauty," 1999

Daniel Day-Lewis & Daniel Day Lewis.

	"My Left Foot," 1989. I also loved him in "In the Name of the Father" and "The Age of Innocence."

Rex Harrison.

	"My Fair Lady," 1964

Russell Crowe.

	"Gladiator," 2000

Geoffrey Rush.

	"Shine," 1996. A player recommends G.R.'s performance in "Les Miserables" opposite Liam Neeson, who's also great (and should have won Best Actor for "Schindler's List").

Paul Scofield.

	"A Man for All Seasons," 1966. Fantastic performance--what a great actor! He's also wonderful in "Quiz Show" opposite Ralph Fiennes. If anyone wants to recommend more movies that any of these guys were in, send me a note and I'll add 'em in.
